Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Silvia Carreno-Coll: Initial Appearance as to Julia I. Mejias-Martinez held on 4/26/2012. AUSA Eugenio Lomba was present. Defendant was interviewed by the Probation Officer and was  brought before the Magistrate Judge, was advised of rights and provided with copy of the Indictment. Financial Affidavit was issued and approved. By Order of the Court, counsel Jose Gaztambide is directly appointed to represent defendant. The Court set bond as to Julia I. Mejias-Martinez (7) in the amount of $5,000 unsecured. Standard release conditions, home incarceration with electronic monitoring device are imposed. Arraignment set for 5/1/2012 09:30 AM in Courtroom 8 before US Magistrate Judge Silvia Carreno-Coll. (br) (Entered: 04/30/2012)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Silvia Carreno-Coll: Arraignment/Detention as to Gabriel Gonzalez-Soto (21) Count 1,2-4,5,6 held on 5/24/2012. AUSA Michael Bagge and defense counsel Julio C. Alejandro were present. As to the Arraignment, the Court finds defendant competent at this time. Defendant waived the reading of the indictment. Plea of Not Guilty is entered. Defense is granted seven (7) days to obtain discovery and fourteen (14) days thereafter to file all motions. The case is referred to the Judge for trial setting thereafter. As to Detention, defense counsel informed that defendant request to be detained, but will request to reserve the right to reopen the matter of bail. The Court noted the reservation and ordered defendant detained without bail. Defense counsel informed that defendant has a metal plate in his head and requested that his mental condition be assessed. The Court ordered that a second notice to MDC be sent for mental health evaluation and treatment or medication that he may require. (Court Reporter FTR/bg.) Hearing set for 01:30. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez- Rive:Bond Revocation Hearing as to Jose Lisboa-Lopez held on 11/16/2012. Present were AUSA Michael Bagge, Mr. Juan Masini-Soler and PO G. Montanez. Defense counsel requested that defendant be given a second chance, that this was his first violation and that there were several issues involved in this violation. Arguments heard from the Government requesting detention. Mr. Masini opposes detention. PO Montanez heard by the Court. After hearing all parties, the Court admonished defendant as to the importance of complying with all conditions imposed and granted him another opportunity. Conditions were modified to include mental health treatment. The importance of not entering the housing project was stressed once again. All other conditions of release remained as previously imposed. (Court Reporter -FTR.)Hearing set for 09:00.Hearing held at 09:27.Hearing ended at 09:40.Interpreter -Anni Navarro. Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Francisco A. Besosa: Status Conference as to Carlos Gonzalez-Soto (25) held on 11/21/2014. Present: AUSA Dennise Longo and Atty. Raul Bandas. Defendant informed that he met with AUSA Castellon to discuss the case; a plea offer was received. Defendant's prior convictions and whether he is a career offender was discussed. Mr. Bandas indicated that he will file a motion requesting to review the pretrial report. Defense counsel requested additional time to review the report and discuss discovery and the offer with his client. STA is tolled until 1/8/2015 in light of the pending negotiations. Pursuant to 18 U.S.C. §§ 3161(h)(8), the Court finds that the ends of justice served by the additional time granted to the parties outweigh the best interest of the public and the defendant in a speedy trial. Motion for change of plea due by 1/8/2015. Proposed voir dire questions and proposed final jury instructions due by 1/8/2015. Pretrial Conference (or for a change of plea hearing if a motion is filed) set for 1/13/2015 at 09:00 AM in Courtroom 2 before Judge Francisco A. Besosa. Jury Trial set for 1/20/2015 at 09:00 AM in Courtroom 2 before Judge Francisco A. Besosa. (Court Reporter Joe Reynosa.)Hearing set for 09:00.Hearing held at 09:16.Hearing ended at 09:30. (grf) (Entered: 11/21/2014)

ORDER denying 1790 Motion to Continue as to Jose L. Gonzalez-Marti (39). This is the second request for a continuance. The parties are proposing a continuance short of a month. Fed. R. Crim. Proc. 32.1 provides for a prompt preliminary hearing. This request is not warranted and does not provide for the holding of a prompt hearing. The court would be more amenable to a shorter extension of time, but not a whole month. If the parties feel that they indeed need the extension they may refile and request a shorter period. Signed by US Magistrate Judge Silvia Carreno-Coll on 04/13/2018. (Carreno- Coll, Silvia) (Entered: 04/13/2018)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Silvia Carreno-Coll: Preliminary Revocation Hearing re 1759 Motion Notifying Violations of Supervision Conditions as to Jose L. Gonzalez-Marti (39) held on 4/16/2018. Present were AUSA Seth Erbe, AFPD Lance Aduba and U.S. Probation Officers Olivia Beltran and Martin De Santiago. The defendant was on bond, present in court and assisted by the Court Interpreter. The Government called USPO Beltran to the witness stand. Direct and cross examination conducted. Government's exhibit 1 was presented and admitted into evidence. Defendant's exhibit A and B were presented and admitted into evidence. Defense counsel shall produce, within 3 working days, an unmarked copy of the Police Report (exhibit A) and the translation of exhibits A and B. After having heard the  parties the Court did not find probable cause as to the allegations in the motion filed by USPO Beltran. The defendant shall continue under the sane conditions of release. (Court Reporter DCR / Courtroom 8.) Hearing set for 09:30. Hearing held at 10:45. Hearing ended at 11:32. Interpreter Enith Valdes. (ram) (Entered: 04/20/2018)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marshal D. Morgan:Bail Hearing as to Edwin Lopez-Tomasini (22) held on 2/28/2020. Present: AUSA Maria Montanez, AFPD Cherrelle Herbert and USPO Ivelisse Alonso. The defendant was present, under custody and assisted by a certified court interpreter. The Government had no objection to the defendant being released on bail so long as specific conditions mentioned by AUSA Montanez were also imposed. AFPD Herbert argued for conditions of release pending the final revocation hearing. USPO Alonso's statements were also heard. After having heard the parties, the Court granted the defense's request and ordered the defendant released under the same conditions previously imposed as well as the following added conditions: EMD, curfew from 7:00 PM - 6:00 AM, employment, drug testing and treatment, and mental health evaluation and treatment as necessary. The defendant shall live at his consensual partner's residence in the municipality of Dorado, PR. (Court Reporter DCR-Courtroom 6.)Hearing set for 10:00. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez-Rive: Preliminary Revocation Hearing as to Richard Leroy Arce-Mendez (34) held via VTC on 9/8/2020. Present were AUSA Jenifer Hernandez, AFPD Melanie Matos and USPO Karina Ortiz. The defendant was under custody and present via video. The defendant did not require the assistance of a Court Interpreter. He waived his right to appear physically at the hearing and consented to proceed via video. Defense counsel stated that they will not contest violations contained in motions 2040 and 2060 . Therefore the Court found probable cause as to the same. The Preliminary hearing was limited to the violations contained in motion 2043 . USPO Ortiz was called to testify by the Government. Direct and cross examination conducted. After having heard the parties, the Court also found probable cause as to the violations contained in motion 2043 . The case is referred to the Presiding Judge for a final revocation hearing. Defense counsel argued in favor of conditions or release pending the final hearing. The Government opposed. The Court ordered the defendant detained pending further proceedings. (Court Reporter Robin Dispenzieri.) Hearing set for 9:30 AM. Hearing held at 9:30 AM. Hearing ended at 10:26 AM. (cmd) (Entered: 09/08/2020)

Miu£nute entry for proceedings held before U.S. District Judge Francisco A. Besosa. Final Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release as to Jonathan Rodriguez-Gonzalez (19) held on September 9, 2020. Present: AUSA Linet Suarez, and AFPD Lauren E.S. Rosen. USPO Taisa Mojica also present. The defendant was under custody and assisted by certified interpreter Mayra Cardona. All parties connected remotely. The defendant waived his right to appear physically for today's hearing and agreed to proceed via VTC. The Court made a finding that the defendant knowingly and voluntarily waived the right to be physically present for today's proceedings since he has consented to proceed by videoconference after consultation with his counsel of record. Certified interpreter  Mayra Cardona was acting and assisting the defendant on a secured line, as well, at MDC-Guaynabo and the Court had a clear view of him on screen. As to the Revocation on supervised release, the defendant waived the hearing and accepted the violations of the conditions of supervised release as stated by the U.S. Probation Office at ECF No. 2011. AFPD Rosen proceeded to provide several mitigations factors to be considered by the Court and submitted a proposed plan for treatment for her client once released. The United States requested a guideline sentence of at least 4 months. Defendant's allocution heard. After hearing the parties, the Court made a finding that the defendant violated the conditions of supervised release previously imposed. Imprisonment of 6 months imposed with a supervised release term of 42 months to be served under the same supervised conditions previously imposed, and the following condition added today; the defendant Gonzalez-Rodriguez shall participate in an inpatient community-based substance abuse treatment program until successful completion. If defendant Gonzalez- Rodriguez is not admitted to inpatient program upon release from prison, he shall be placed in home incarceration with location monitoring until admission is completed. All terms and conditions are specified in the judgment of revocation form. The defendant was advised as to his right to appeal, etc. (Court Reporter Joe Reynosa (VTC).)Hearing set for 09:00.Hearing held at 09:30.Hearing ended at 09:55. Interpreter Mayra Cardona (VTC). (om) (Entered: 09/09/2020)
JUDGMENT ON REVOCATION as to Jonathan Gonzalez-Rodriguez (19). Impr of 6 months. SRT of 42 months. Signed by Judge Francisco A. Besosa on 9/9/2020.(om) (Entered: 09/09/2020)

Munute entry for proceedings held before U.S. District Judge Francisco A. Besosa. Final Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release as to Richard Leroy Arce-Mendez (34) held on October 19, 2020. Present: AUSA Jenifer Y. Hernandez-Vega, and AFPD Melanie Matos. USPO Karina Ortiz also present. The defendant was under custody at the MDC-Guaynabo, and services of certified court interpreter present not required. All parties connected remotely. The record should reflect the proceedings are being held by VTC, given the emergency situation created by the COVID-19 pandemic. Therefore, the defendant has consented to proceed by VTC, and defendant has secured a waiver to that effect that appears on the record filed at ECF No. 2078. Notwithstanding, the Court made a finding that the defendant knowingly and voluntarily waived the right to be physically present for today's proceedings, since the defendant has consented to proceed by videoconference after consultation with his counsel of record AFPD Melanie Matos. Services of Certified Court Sonia Crescioni not required. Defendant detained at MDC- Guaynabo and the Court had a clear view of him on screen. The defendant waived the hearing and accepted the violations of the conditions of supervised release as stated by the U.S. Probation Office at ECF Nos. 2040, 2043, 2059, and 2072. AFPD Matos proceeded to provide several mitigations factors to be considered by the Court and requested a term of time served with intensive impatient treatment. The United States requested that a term of imprisonment of 6 months with home detention with electronic monitoring be imposed. Defendant's allocution heard. After hearing the parties, the Court made a finding that the defendant has violated the conditions of supervised release previously imposed by using illegal substances, interacting with a convicted felon, not following the instructions of the probation officer and by failing to abide the location monitoring conditions as indicated in the motion filed by the U.S. Probation Officer on August 10, 2020 and the supplemental motions filed on August 20, September 1 and September 21, 2020. Accordingly, the supervised release term imposed on November 21, 2019 was revoked. The Court before revoking the defendant, placed several factors considered and imposed a term of Imprisonment of 12 months with a supervised release term of 3 years. All terms and conditions are specified in the judgment of revocation form. The defendant was advised as to his right to appeal, etc. AFPD Melanie Matos objected the term of imprisonment imposed to her client. (Court Reporter Joe Reynosa (VTC).)Hearing set for 01:30.Hearing held at 01:35.Hearing ended at 02:01 .Interpreter No required. USPO Karina Ortiz (VTC). (om) (Entered: 10/19/2020)
JUDGMENT ON REVOCATION as to Richard Leroy Arce-Mendez (34). Impr of 12 months. SRT of 3 years. Signed by Judge Francisco A. Besosa on 10/19/2020.(om) (Entered: 10/19/2020)

ORDER as to Anibal Crespo-Davila (36) re 2138 Informative Motion Notifying Violations of Supervision Conditions, filed by US Probation Office. Implementation of the proposed supervision action plan is DENIED. Defendant has tested positive to controlled substances on five (5) occasions within one year. Revocation is required after three (3) positives within one year. 18 USC Section 3583(g)(4). Additionally, it appears that defendant cannot or will not follow the USPO's instructions and ignores her counselling. Accordingly, an arrest warrant shall be issued, and defendant once arrested shall be brought to the US Magistrate Judge on duty for preliminary hearing and appointment of counsel. Signed by Judge Francisco A. Besosa on 4/8/2021.(om) (Entered: 04/08/2021)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marshal D. Morgan: Initial Appearance on Revocation of Supervised Release as to Anibal Crespo- Davila (36) held on 4/23/2021. Present: AUSA Maria Montanez and AFPD Victor Miranda. The defendant was present, under custody and assisted by a certified court interpreter. All parties were present via VTC. The Court found that the defendant knowingly and voluntarily waived his right to attend this hearing in person and consented to proceed by way of VTC. The defendant was advised of the SRT violations alleged in the Motion filed by USPO Lopez at Docket No. 2138 . The defendant was also advised of his rights, including his right to a preliminary hearing. The Federal Public Defender was appointed to represent the defendant. The Court ordered the defendant temporarily detained pending further proceedings. Pursuant to the Due Process Protections Act, Pub. L. No. 116-182, 134 Stat. 894 (Oct. 21, 2020) and Rule 5(f) of the Federal Rules of Criminal Procedure, the United States is reminded of its obligation to disclose in a timely manner all exculpatory evidence to the defendant(s], that is, all evidence that is favorable to the defendant(s] or tends to cast doubt on the United States' case, as required by Brady v. Maryland, 373 U.S. 83 (1963) and its progeny. Failure to comply with this order may result in consequences, including, but not limited to, the reversal of any conviction, the exclusion of evidence, adverse jury instructions, dismissal of charges, contempt proceedings, disciplinary action, and/or sanctions by the Court. A Preliminary Revocation Hearing was set for 5/4/2021 at 2:30 PM via VTC Bridge MDM before US Magistrate Judge Marshal D. Morgan. (Court Reporter DCR/ ZoomGov Recording.) Hearing held at 02:13. Hearing ended at 02:19. Interpreter Carlos Ravelo. (mig) (Entered: 04/26/2021)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marshal D. Morgan: Preliminary Revocation Hearing as to Anibal Crespo-Davila (36) was held on 5/24/2021. Present: AUSA Steven Liong, AFPD Joseph Niskar and USPO Mitzaida Lopez. The defendant was present, under custody at MDC and assisted by a certified court interpreter. All parties were present via VTC, except the defendant who appeared by phone. The Court found that the defendant knowingly and voluntarily waived his right to attend this hearing in person and consented to proceed by way of TC. AFPD  Niskar requested release of the defendant to Guara-bi. AUSA Liong agreed as to impatient release but opposed as to outpatient release. USPO Lopez informed of Hogar Crea as an outpatient option. The Defendant agreed with the USPO as to the outpatient treatment option. The Court modified the defendant's conditions of supervised release as follows: The defendant is to be released conditioned to home confinement until he is admitted to Hogar Crea to participate in a 18-month outpatient drug treatment program, once the USPO informs the availability of the facility. Upon the mentioned agreement, the preliminary revocation hearing 1s no longer necessary. (Court Reporter DCR/ ZoomGov Recording.)Hearing set for 11:30.Hearing held at 11:34.Hearing ended at 12:01.Interpreter Olga Uribe. (mig) (Entered: 05/24/2021)
